item.title: John add a quote by Steven Millhauser
item.description: "So imagine a fire going -- wood snapping the way it does when it’s a little green — the wind rattling the windows behind the curtains -- and one of those Chopin melodies that feel like sorrow and ecstasy all mixed together pouring from the keys -- and you have my idea of happiness. Or just reading, reading and lamplight, the sound of pages turning. And so you dare to be happy. You do that thing. You dare." -- Steven Millhauser

item.title: John add a quote by Steven Millhauser
item.description: "All words are masks and the lovelier they are, the more they are meant to conceal." -- Steven Millhauser

item.title: John add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "California deserves whatever it gets. Californians invented the concept of life-style. This alone warrants their doom." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: John add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "What good is knowledge if it just floats in the air? It goes from computer to computer. It changes and grows every second of every day. But nobody actually knows anything." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: John add a quote by Denis Johnson
item.description: "Down the hall came the wife. She was glorious, burning. She didn't know yet that her husband was dead. We knew. That's what gave her such power over us. The doctor took her into a room with a desk at the end of the hall, and from under the closed door a slab of brilliance radiated as if, by some stupendous process, diamonds were being incinerated in there. What a pair of lungs! She shrieked as I imagined an eagle would shriek. It felt wonderful to be alive to hear it! I've gone looking for that feeling everywhere." -- Denis Johnson

item.title: John add a quote by Janet Malcolm
item.description: "Every journalist who is not too stupid or full of himself to notice what is going on knows that what he does is morally indefensible. He is a kind of confidence man, preying on people's vanity, ignorance, or loneliness, gaining their trust and betraying them without remorse." -- Janet Malcolm

item.title: John add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: John add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "The role of the artist is to ask questions, not answer them." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: John add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Man is what he believes." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: John add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "This life of ours...human life is like a flower gloriously blooming in a meadow: along comes a goat, eats it up---no more flower." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: John add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "The only reason we don't open our hearts and minds to other people is that they trigger confusion in us that we don't feel brave enough or sane enough to deal with. To the degree that we look clearly and compassionately at ourselves, we feel confident and fearless about looking into someone else's eyes. " -- Pema Chodron

item.title: John add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "You are the sky. Everything else – it’s just the weather." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: John add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "All he had ever prayed for was the ability to catch outfield flies, in answer to which God had bestowed upon him a penis that was bigger than anybody else's. What kind of world came up with such idiotic bargains?" -- Haruki Murakami
